page.title: 04LANGUAGE
page.content: {LANGUAGE} There are many local people who have Cornish names but are probably unaware of their meanings. The language, which is derived from Celtic, is being revived but few are fluent. The following names are taken from people in the school community: Pascoe = Easter child Lugg = calf Bray = hill Caddy = house surrounded by a hedge Bligh = wolf Pengelly = end or head of copse Pellow = distant, far off Gear = hill fort Trewin = fair Moyle = bald or bare Cara = lover Kemp = neat and tidy Bosustow = dwelling of Ustow Jewell = Cornish royalty
